node.title: Terrorist's lawyer intends seeking a judicial review of Royal Commission's findings
node.description: The lawyer for the terrorist who murdered 51 people in the Christchurch mosque attacks says he intends to seek a judicial review of the Royal Commission.
node.content:
["The lawyer for the terrorist who murdered 51 people in the Christchurch mosque attacks says he intends to seek a judicial review of the Royal Commission.", "", "
Coroner Brigitte Windley is heading the inquiry. Photo: POOL / STUFF LTD
", "Ron Mansfield QC has told a coronial hearing terrorist Brenton Tarrant only received a copy of the commission's report on 15 February this year.", "The terrorist asserts that it contains factual errors, Mansfield told the hearing.", "He has suggested to Coroner Brigitte Windley that she put a red line through the report, calling the inquiry a "failure of the exercise of natural justice".", ""There was a need for much of its work to be conducted in secrecy. That's why it's not so shocking that I say it was a failure in the exercise of natural justice because of the work that it was required to do meant that it needed to be in camera or in secret.", ""It's easy to see how at least part of its work could have been conducted in public, allowing the families and all interested parties the opportunity to understand the evidence ... and be afforded the opportunity to test that evidence as far as was appropriate.", ""It chose not to do that, but in so doing, in my submission it failed as far as a rights-compliant investigation."", "Mansfield said the Department of Corrections had denied Tarrant access to material he should have received as part of the coronial inquiry.", ""That logically means he's had an inability to be able to correspond with the commission regarding mistakes of fact that he asserts are made within the report, facts that are relied on by the royal commission for its recommendations.", ""Not only will he correspond through counsel with the royal commission in an effort to ensure that errors of fact are corrected, he proposes to judicially review the royal commission in relation to the way in which it's conducted its work and in particular some of its factual findings and recommendations."", "", "
Ron Mansfield addressing the hearing via a video link. Photo: POOL / STUFF LTD
", "A coronial hearing is examining the final moments in the lives of 51 Muslims murdered in the Christchurch terror attacks on 15 March 2019.", "The inquiry was opened to address any unanswered questions following the criminal investigation and prosecution process and the Royal Commission of Inquiry.", "Its purpose is to establish the circumstances of the deaths and make recommendations to reduce the chance of other attacks happening in similar circumstances.", "In its submission earlier today, the Human Rights Commission urged the coroner to put victims of the mosque attacks at the heart of the inquiry.", "The Royal Commission, which examined sensitive intelligence and security matters, was held in private and some evidence was suppressed for 30 years.", "The commission's lawyer, John Hancock, told the hearing the coronial inquiry was a chance to give the issues the public scrutiny they deserved and consider them from the families' perspective.", ""Significant weight should be accorded to the views of the affected families, survivors and witnesses. Their participation was not central to the royal commission's inquiry but it is much more central, I would submit, to this particular inquiry," he said.", ""There are a plethora of questions that were left unanswered."", "", "
John Hancock makes his submission on behalf of the Human Rights Commission. Photo: Screenshot
", "The entire coronial hearing is being held remotely, via video link, because of the Covid-19 risk.", "It is expected to finish today."]
